trans-unit.source: This will restore your last registered address format.

trans-unit.source: This will restore the default address format for this country.

trans-unit.source: This will restore your current address format.
trans-unit.target: This will restore your current address format.

trans-unit.source: This will delete the current address format
trans-unit.target: This will delete the current address format

trans-unit.target: This expression uses a special syntax:

trans-unit.source: There are [1]%replace%[/1] products
trans-unit.target: There are [1]%replace%[/1] products

trans-unit.source: "%s" will be replaced by a number.
trans-unit.target: "%s" will be replaced by a number.

trans-unit.target: List of pages in [1]%replace%[/1]

trans-unit.source: "%s" will be replaced by a string.

trans-unit.source: Click on the title of a section to open its fieldsets.
trans-unit.target: Click on the title of a section to open its fieldsets.

trans-unit.source: Here you can modify translations for all installed module.
trans-unit.target: Here you can modify translations for all installed module.

trans-unit.source: Select your module
trans-unit.target: Select your module

trans-unit.source: Restrict country selections in front office to those covered by active carriers
trans-unit.target: Restrict country selections in front office to those covered by active carriers

trans-unit.source: Two -- or three -- letter ISO code (e.g. "us" for United States).
trans-unit.target: Two -- or three -- letter ISO code (e.g. "us" for United States).

trans-unit.source: International call prefix, (e.g. 1 for United States).
trans-unit.target: International call prefix, (e.g. 1 for United States).

trans-unit.source: Geographical region.
trans-unit.target: Geographical region.

trans-unit.source: Indicate the format of the postal code: use L for a letter, N for a number, and C for the country's ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code. For example, NNNNN for the United States, France, Poland and many other; LNNNNLLL for Argentina, etc. If you do not want PrestaShop to verify the postal code for this country, leave it blank.
trans-unit.target: Indicate the format of the postal code: use L for a letter, N for a number, and C for the country's ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code. For example, NNNNN for the United States, France, Poland and many other; LNNNNLLL for Argentina, etc. If you do not want PrestaShop to verify the postal code for this country, leave it blank.

trans-unit.source: Display this country to your customers (the selected country will always be displayed in the Back Office).
trans-unit.target: Display this country to your customers (the selected country will always be displayed in the Back Office).

trans-unit.source: Provide the state name to be displayed in addresses and on invoices.
trans-unit.target: Provide the state name to be displayed in addresses and on invoices.

trans-unit.source: 1 to 4 letter ISO code.
trans-unit.target: 1 to 4 letter ISO code.

trans-unit.source: You can prefix it with the country ISO code if needed.
trans-unit.target: You can prefix it with the country ISO code if needed.

trans-unit.source: Country where the state is located.
trans-unit.target: Country where the state is located.

trans-unit.source: Only the countries with the option "contains states" enabled are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Only the countries with the option "contains states" enabled are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Geographical region where this state is located.
trans-unit.target: Geographical region where this state is located.

trans-unit.source: Used for shipping
trans-unit.target: Used for shipping

trans-unit.source: You can define a range of Zip/Postal codes (e.g., 75000-75015) or simply use one Zip/Postal code.
trans-unit.target: You can define a range of Zip/Postal codes (e.g., 75000-75015) or simply use one Zip/Postal code.

trans-unit.source: You must define the behavior if an address matches multiple rules:
trans-unit.target: You must define the behavior if an address matches multiple rules:

trans-unit.source: - This tax only: Will apply only this tax
trans-unit.target: - This tax only: Will apply only this tax

trans-unit.source: - Combine: Combine taxes (e.g.: 10% + 5% = 15%)
trans-unit.target: - Combine: Combine taxes (e.g.: 10% + 5% = 15%)

trans-unit.source: - One after another: Apply taxes one after another (e.g.: 100 + 10% => 110 + 5% = 115.5)
trans-unit.target: - One after another: Apply taxes one after another (e.g.: 100 + 10% => 110 + 5% = 115.5)

trans-unit.source: No Tax
trans-unit.target: No VAT

trans-unit.source: (Total tax: 9%)
trans-unit.target: (Total tax: 9%)

trans-unit.source: By default, PrestaShop comes with a list of official currencies. If you want to use a local currency, you will have to add it manually. For example, to accept the Iranian Toman on your store, you need to create it before.
trans-unit.target: By default, PrestaShop comes with a list of official currencies. If you want to use a local currency, you will have to add it manually. For example, to accept the Iranian Toman on your store, you need to create it before.

trans-unit.source: ISO 4217 code (e.g. USD for Dollars, EUR for Euros, etc.)
trans-unit.target: ISO 4217 code (e.g. USD for Dollars, EUR for Euros, etc.)

trans-unit.source: Exchange rates are calculated from one unit of your shop's default currency. For example, if the default currency is euros and your chosen currency is dollars, type "1.20" (1€ = $1.20).
trans-unit.target: Exchange rates are calculated from one unit of your shop's default currency. For example, if the default currency is euros and your chosen currency is dollars, type "1.20" (1€ = $1.20).

trans-unit.source: Exchange rates are calculated from one unit of your store's default currency. For example, if the default currency is euros and your chosen currency is dollars, type "1.20" (1€ = $1.20).
trans-unit.target: Exchange rates are calculated from one unit of your store's default currency. For example, if the default currency is euros and your chosen currency is dollars, type "1.20" (1€ = $1.20).

trans-unit.source: Exchange rates are calculated from one unit of your store's default currency. For example, if the default currency is euros and your chosen currency is dollars, type "1.20" (1€ = $1.20).
trans-unit.target: Exchange rates are calculated from one unit of your store's default currency. For example, if the default currency is euros and your chosen currency is dollars, type "1.20" (1€ = $1.20).

trans-unit.source: This option allows you, among other things, to restrict access to your shop for certain countries. See below.
trans-unit.target: This option allows you, among other things, to restrict access to your shop for certain countries. See below.

trans-unit.source: Two-letter ISO code (e.g. FR, EN, DE).
trans-unit.target: Two-letter ISO code (e.g. FR, EN, DE).

trans-unit.source: IETF language tag (e.g. en-US, pt-BR).
trans-unit.target: IETF language tag (e.g. en-US, pt-BR).

trans-unit.source: Short date format (e.g., Y-m-d).
trans-unit.target: Short date format (e.g., Y-m-d).

trans-unit.source: Full date format (e.g., Y-m-d H:i:s).
trans-unit.target: Full date format (e.g., Y-m-d H:i:s).

trans-unit.source: Upload the country flag from your computer.
trans-unit.target: Upload the country flag from your computer.

trans-unit.source: Image is displayed when no picture is found.
trans-unit.target: Image is displayed when no picture is found.

trans-unit.source: Enable if this language is read from right to left.
trans-unit.target: Enable if this language is read from right to left.

trans-unit.source: (Experimental: your theme must be compliant with RTL languages).
trans-unit.target: (Experimental: your theme must be compliant with RTL languages).

trans-unit.source: Activate this language.
trans-unit.target: Activate this language.

trans-unit.source: The ISO 639-1 identifier for the language of the country where your web server is located (en, fr, sp, ru, pl, nl, etc.).
trans-unit.target: The ISO 639-1 identifier for the language of the country where your web server is located (en, fr, sp, ru, pl, nl, etc.).

trans-unit.source: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 identifier for the country/region where your web server is located, in lowercase (us, gb, fr, sp, ru, pl, nl, etc.).
trans-unit.target: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 identifier for the country/region where your web server is located, in lowercase (us, gb, fr, sp, ru, pl, nl, etc.).

trans-unit.source: If set to yes then the localization pack will be downloaded from prestashop.com. Otherwise the local xml file found in the localization folder of your PrestaShop installation will be used.
trans-unit.target: If set to yes then the localization pack will be downloaded from prestashop.com. Otherwise the local xml file found in the localization folder of your PrestaShop installation will be used.

trans-unit.source: The default weight unit for your shop (e.g. "kg" for kilograms, "lbs" for pound-mass, etc.).
trans-unit.target: The default weight unit for your shop (e.g. "kg" for kilograms, "lbs" for pound-mass, etc.).

trans-unit.source: The default distance unit for your shop (e.g. "km" for kilometer, "mi" for mile, etc.).
trans-unit.target: The default distance unit for your shop (e.g. "km" for kilometre, "mi" for mile, etc.).

trans-unit.source: The default volume unit for your shop (e.g. "L" for liter, "gal" for gallon, etc.).
trans-unit.target: The default volume unit for your shop (e.g. "L" for litre, "gal" for gallon, etc.).

trans-unit.source: The default dimension unit for your shop (e.g. "cm" for centimeter, "in" for inch, etc.).
trans-unit.target: The default dimension unit for your shop (e.g. "cm" for centimetre, "in" for inch, etc.).

trans-unit.source: The default language used in your shop.
trans-unit.target: The default language used in your shop.

trans-unit.source: Set browser language as default language.
trans-unit.target: Set browser language as default language.

trans-unit.source: The default country used in your shop.
trans-unit.target: The default country used in your shop.

trans-unit.source: Set country corresponding to browser language.
trans-unit.target: Set country corresponding to browser language.

trans-unit.source: The default currency used in your shop.
trans-unit.target: The default currency used in your shop.

trans-unit.source: Zone name (e.g. Africa, West Coast, Neighboring Countries).
trans-unit.target: Zone name (e.g. Africa, West Coast, Neighboring Countries).

trans-unit.source: Allow or disallow shipping to this zone.
trans-unit.target: Allow or disallow shipping to this zone.

trans-unit.source: Select whether or not to include tax on purchases.
trans-unit.target: Select whether or not to include tax on purchases.

trans-unit.source: Select whether or not to display tax on a distinct line in the cart.
trans-unit.target: Select whether or not to display tax on a distinct line in the cart.

trans-unit.source: If you disable the ecotax, the ecotax for all your products will be set to 0.
trans-unit.target: If you disable the ecotax, the ecotax for all your products will be set to 0.

trans-unit.source: Define the ecotax (e.g. French ecotax: 20%).
trans-unit.target: Define the ecotax (e.g. French ecotax: 20%).

trans-unit.source: Tax name to display in carts and on invoices (e.g. "VAT").
trans-unit.target: Tax name to display in carts and on invoices (e.g. "VAT").

trans-unit.source: Format: XX.XX or XX.XXX (e.g. 19.60 or 13.925)
trans-unit.target: Format: XX.XX or XX.XXX (e.g. 19.60 or 13.925)

trans-unit.source: You can add IP addresses that will always be allowed to access your shop (e.g. Google bots' IP).
trans-unit.target: You can add IP addresses that will always be allowed to access your shop (e.g. Google bots' IP).

trans-unit.source: You can add or update a language directly from the PrestaShop website here.
trans-unit.target: You can add or update a language directly from the PrestaShop website here.

trans-unit.source: Copies data from one language to another.
trans-unit.target: Copies data from one language to another.

trans-unit.source: Select which theme you would like to export your translations to.
trans-unit.target: Select which theme you would like to export your translations to.

trans-unit.source: Here you can modify translations for every line of text inside PrestaShop.
trans-unit.target: Here you can modify translations for every line of text inside PrestaShop.

trans-unit.source: First, select a type of translation (such as "Back office" or "Installed modules"), and then select the language you want to translate strings in.
trans-unit.target: First, select a type of translation (such as "Back office" or "Installed modules"), and then select the language you want to translate strings in.
